title: Replace Events Hub post-unlock header logo with uploaded image

requirements.summary: Replace the existing post-unlock Events Hub header logo icon with the user-uploaded image and keep it responsive on mobile.
acceptanceCriteria: On the Events Hub screen (events list after password unlock), the header no longer displays the existing icon logo image currently used in the header.
The header displays the uploaded image as the logo in its place.
The logo remains responsive (does not overflow/crop awkwardly) across common mobile widths.

file_operations.description: Update the header logo rendering to remove the current generated logo icon and instead use the chosen uploaded static asset image (referenced via a stable path under frontend/public). Ensure responsive sizing (e.g., constrained max width/height, object-contain, and appropriate wrapping) so it scales cleanly on common mobile widths without awkward cropping or overflow.

Verify the Events Hub continues to use PostUnlockHeader and that no other logo/icon is redundantly displayed in the header area after the PostUnlockHeader change (no functional change expected; adjust only if needed to prevent duplicate header branding).

requirements.summary: Add the two uploaded images to frontend static assets and reference the selected one from the post-unlock header.
acceptanceCriteria: Both uploaded images are present in the frontend as static assets (served by the frontend, not via backend).
The post-unlock header component references the chosen uploaded image via a stable static path (no broken image link in production build).

file_operations.description: Add the uploaded PNG as a frontend static asset so it can be referenced by a stable path from the UI.
Add the uploaded JPG as a frontend static asset so it can be referenced by a stable path from the UI.
Reference the selected uploaded header logo image from a stable static path (e.g., under frontend/public/assets/uploaded/...) and ensure the img alt text remains in English.
